title: How to Make Rice Pilaf

steps.headline: Find a medium sized saucepan.
steps.description: Pour in the 1 tablespoon of olive oil and heat over medium-high heat.

steps.headline: Add the onion, bell pepper, cumin powder, and salt.
steps.description: Sauté the mixture for about 5 minutes, or until the onion starts to soften.

steps.headline: Add the rice.
steps.description: Stir for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the rice is fully coated.

steps.headline: Add the chicken broth, orange zest, and bay leaf.
steps.description: Continue stirring until the broth starts to boil. You can also add a pinch of saffron steeped in 1/4 cup hot water at this point if desired.

steps.headline: Cover the sauté pan with a lid.

steps.headline: Keeping the pan covered, remove from the heat.

steps.headline: Stir in almonds, currants, or any thing else you wish to add.

text: Find a medium sized saucepan. Pour in the 1 tablespoon of olive oil and heat over medium-high heat. Add the onion, bell pepper, cumin powder, and salt. Sauté the mixture for about 5 minutes, or until the onion starts to soften. Add the rice. Stir for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the rice is fully coated. Add the chicken broth, orange zest, and bay leaf. Continue stirring until the broth starts to boil. You can also add a pinch of saffron steeped in 1/4 cup hot water at this point if desired. Cover the sauté pan with a lid. Reduce the head to low. Allow to simmer for about 20 minutes. Keeping the pan covered, remove from the heat. Let the rice stand until it has absorbed all of the chicken broth. This should take about 5 minutes. If the rice is too dry at this point, boil a little water and add it to the mixture. Then, let it sit for another 5 minutes. Stir in almonds, currants, or any thing else you wish to add. Add black pepper to taste. Finished.
